title: SSIS Format Text column to Currency to show $
body:
add a script component mark the 2 columns as input and create to output columns: outDate and outCurrency

in the script write the following code:

if not Row.Date_ISNull AndAlso not string.isnullorEmpty(Row.Date)
row.outDate = Date.ParseExact(Row.Date,"MM/dd/yyyy", new system.globalization.cultureinfo("en-GB"),none).tostring("yyyy/MM/dd")
else
 row.outDate_IsNull = True

end if


If not row.Currency_IsNUll andAlso not string.isnullorEmpty(row.Currency) Then
row.outcurrency = "$" & Row.Currency
else
Row.outCurrency_IsNull = True
end if

And Mapp the output Column to the Destination Excel

If you want the column in currency format it must be changed from the excel file. Or you have to change it using script task using excel manipulation library like microsoft.office.interop.excel or OpenXML
